subject: Politics
title: What Is Political Philosophy
description: A 60-second lesson on What Is Political Philosophy.

hook.text: Should the state force you to wear a seatbelt? That simple question hides centuries of philosophical debate.

buildup.text: Political philosophy asks the big questions: What is justice? Who should rule? When is power legitimate?

discovery.text: Every law and policy rests on philosophical assumptions about human nature, freedom, and the common good.

twist.text: Most people hold political beliefs without examining them. Philosophy forces you to justify what you take for granted.

climax.text: Political philosophy isn't abstract. It shapes constitutions, courts, and the rules that govern your daily life.

punchline.text: Every political argument is philosophy in disguise. The ideas shape the rules.

quiz.question: What is the primary focus of political philosophy?
options: Questions about justice, power, and legitimacy of government
